citation.article-title: Streptococcus canis sp. nov.: a species of group G streptococci from animals.

p.s: Description of Streptococcus canis sp. nov.
Streptococcus canis (ca'nis. L.n. canis dog)
Cells are gram-positive cocci and occur in pairs or in chains.
Wide zones of β-hemolysis are produced.
CAMP factor negative.
Colonies are circular with entire edges.
A precipitate is formed in broth cultures.
Catalase negative.
Facultatively anaerobic.
Good growth occurs at 37°C.
Not resistant to 6.5% NaCl or 40% bile.
Negative for hippurate, fibrinolysin, tyrosine, starch hydrolysis, Voges-Proskauer, and pyrrolidonylarylamidase reactions.
Positive in L-aminopeptidase, alkaline phosphatase, leucine arylamidase, and arginine dehydrolase tests.
Most strains produce a β-galactosidase, but few strains are hyaluronidase and pglucuronidase positive.
Variable reactions in α-galactosidase tests.

No acid is produced from adonitol, amygdalin, L-arabhose, D-arabinose, D-arabitol, dulcitol, erythritol, D-fucose, L-fucose, β-gentiobiose, gluconate, 2-keto-gluconate, inositol, indin, D-lyxose, mannitol, α-methyl-D-mannoside, melezitose, melibiose, D-raffinose, rhamnose, sorbitol, L-sorbose, D-tagatose, D-turanose, xylitol, D-xylose, L-xylose, or β-methyl-xyloside.
Acid is produced from N-acetylglucosamine, D-fructose, galactose, D-glucose, maltose, D-mannose, ribose, salicine, starch, and sucrose.
A few strains are trehalose positive, and some weak acid reactions may occur with glycogen.
Peptidoglycan type: Lys-Thr-Gly.
The guanine-plus-cytosine content of the DNA ranges from 39 to 40 mol%, as determined by the melting temperature method.
Habitat: skin, upper respiratory tracts, and genitals of dogs, cow udders, and probably also cats (22).
Strains from cats have not been studied in detail.
The type strain is strain DSM 20715 (= STR-T1).
This strain is hyaluronidase negative, α-galactosidase, pgalactosidase, α-methyl-glucoside, cellobiose, and lactose positive, and β-glucuronidase, 5-keto-gluconate, glycogen, and trehalose negative.
The guanine-plus-cytosine content of the DNA is 39.5 mol%, as determined by the melting temperature method.
Other characters of the type strain are as given above.
